comments.commentBody: Never mind raising the highest marginal rates back to Clinton days; how about back up to Reagan days (50%), or Nixon days (70+%), or Eisenhower (91%)?  The latter was to pay for WWII and the economy did just fine,

Having served over there twice and recently returned...the U.S. achieved it's objectives of ending Taliban rule and closing terrorist training camps by the spring of 2002. Since the spring of 2002, Afghanistan was no longer a threat to it's neighbors, the region or the U.S. and it's allies...The internal security issues since then have been the responsibility of the Afghans...it's time to give it to them.
Regarding corruption, what we call corruption in Afghanistan, we call "lobbying" and "subcontracting" in the U.S...

When one reads Obama War one wonders why he allowed Adm. Mullen to even stay this long. Same is true of even Secy GATES. Both of them ar hawksw and very close to Pakistan so much so that Ambs. Huqqanit can walk into their offices without any appointment and they will meet the list provided by Gen.Kiyani .Adm.Mullen is more closer to Gen.Kiyani and this move by Obama may shutdown the golden goose. Maybe we are dreaming as the cold war mindset may still keep laying those Golden eggs but one can feel the dispointment on both Gates and Mullen. War is what they live for

Well, I suggest Mike deal with it and make it happen.  It's not impossible and Mullen knows it.  His first reaction to any suggestion given to him is negative.  His job is to take Orders from the President and see that they are carried out.

This is pure theatre.  You cannot cross the Rubicon 47 years after an unacknowledged coup d'etat.  This mock struggle between Obama and the CIA/military is pure PR puppet show at this point.  More like Surfing the Rubicon.

People, stop saying "we" are in Iraq and Afghanistan. I live in Sweden. Our politicians sent troops to take part in the illegal Afghanistan occupation (thereby committing a war crime) without any public debate whatsoever. "We" are not in Afghanistan. Whether "we" are Swedes or Americans or anyone else. The politicians sent their mercenaries to carry out their agenda.

When you are tricked into saying "we" are in Afghanistan, you have fallen for the fundamental lie about the occupation.

By the way, chaos if "we" pull out? I'd prefer chaos to the neocon/globalist oppression. Let the Afghans overthrow Hamid Karzai and his cabal of Uzbek drug smugglers and the remnants of the Afghanistan Communist Party. The "northern coalition" like some American columnist cleverly named them. Out with them and let's have "chaos" - meaning a return to decentralized tribal rule.

"Yeah, my brother broke into the neighbors' house and is holding them at gunpoint. Now he says 'we' can't leave the house because then they'd go ape and turn the house into 'chaos.' So we have to take our 'responsibility' and keep threatening them."

Please.  Of course it's riskier.  But that's why we have an elected Commander in Chief.  If he's wrong he can be voted out next election.  If a General or Admiral makes a wrong decision, he gets transferred to a less demanding post. Have we forgotten the Bay of Pigs ? MacArthur and the drive to the Yalu?

@Carl No. 14 - No good sir, t'was YOU who finished pounding that nail into the coffin of truth! Check out the documentary that is one of the finest unmasking jobs of what is truly at the bottom of the barrel of pig waste.  It is called America to Fascism and gentlemen, the day is nigh, I doubt there is any turning back anymore.  This madness will have to play out now to its gory, filthy, inhuman end.  Brace yourselves children of the world for we have left you a planet bereft of.....well most everything to make life human and humane....yours will be a world of technological fascism unlike anything ever known in recorded history.  I am glad I got to be a person and not a robot slave.  What an ugly race of parasitic murderers  we turned out to be.  It's all a damn shame.

Pakistan should weed out all terrorists within their state. There is no good terrorist, fail to understand why America should buy their trust?

Too many people have lost their lives on either side, these double dealings should cease immediately.

Sadly Pakistan has for long has been willing to sleep with the highest bidder.

It's been reported for years that regional ISI operatives turn a blind eye to the Harakat-ul-Mujahedeen, who in turn have contacts with al-Qaeda. It doesn't mean Islamabad was sheltering bin Laden, or even knew he was there. Get a grip people.
Cut the military aid and replace it with civilian ones. Only then can we hope that the rogue and inflated military establishment gets under control.

Chris Christie said “I’ve finally done what I said I would do when I got here, which is to have somebody in this building advocating for the taxpayer, rather than advocating for the special-interest unions.”

What I would give to see someone advocate for the middle class and a sensible policy of tax increases and spending cuts, rather than for special interests, corporate profits, and ideology.

For the GOP, ending tax cuts for the rich is off the table.

Therein lies much of the problem.

Cantor
"There is not support in the House for a tax increase, and I don’t believe now is the time to raise taxes in light of our current economic situation"

Raising taxes on the rich will have no perceivable negative impact on the economy. This is pure horse sh*t.

The rich are paying a lower tax rate than working people, because most of their income is capital gains at 15%.

Boehner says high corporate tax rates and regulatons are killing the economy.
That is a lie.
Corporate tax rates are at a 60 year low.
As a percentage of total federal income tax revenue, corporate taxes are 1/4 of what they were in 1950.

Deregulation is one of the main culprits that brought on the economic collapse to begin with.

The GOP is using the cover of deficit reduction to unravel 60 years of environmental protection and progress. That is their aim and what motivates their anti-regulation agenda.

The GOP has no incentive to improve the economy or job situation.
That's why they have shifted the debate to the deficit.
It the job market improves, Obama will be re-elected, which goes against their only stated goal.

Corporations are sitting on $2 trillion cash andare not hiring.
Instead they are buying equipment.

They and the rich are doing just fine, thank you.
It's working people who are suffering.

They fool those who watch Fox News with all these lies, which isn't hard. Twenty seven separate polls have found that Fox Noise watchers are the most mis-informed people in the country. They are less informed than those who watch no news at all.

USA is still a naive to understand Pakistani's complicated mind set of power brokering. Unless USA grows up in the face of Pakistani sophisticated sopy networks, there is danger ahead given it has the nuclear arsenols. I who lived in Pakistan for 27 years knew in day one of Tora Bora fight that Bin Laden is in Pakistan under ISI protection. I wrote a letter to the News & Observer but they will not publish it. My guess is that the paper did not want to offend the then friendly relationship. Pakistna was never a friend and will never a friend to USA. Pakisdtna is a friend to Islamic Jihad group for survival of military power over democratic or civilian government. ISI and military is using the nuclear power to show to the world that they are in control. World should better understnad it and deal with it as early as possible before it is too late when a nuclear disaster happens.

As a Pakistani, I'm disappointed with Pakistan's incessant misbehavior. There's a limit to misbehavior. ISI has to go after all militant organization in every nook and cranny of Pakistan. There's no escaping the ground reality that Pakistan is fraught with hard wired, thugs and killers who will maim and murder anyone that's even remotely different from them. Is this the kind of Islam that the Pakistani military believes in? If so, then the wimpish and coward generals would be rolling in their graves for inadvertently supporting the ideology of hatred that's responsible of the murders of thousands of Pakistani civilians and soldiers.

Shame on the impotent and feckless policies of the Pakistani Military to allow nihilistic, uneducated goons to flourish in the country. This is getting intolerable. Pakistani Army must mend its ways. I simply cannot express my frustration, anger and hatred for the Army because of the Frankenstein that they created and have allowed to flourish in the country. I feel like sucker punching all the Pakistani Generals. They don't deserve any iota of respect because they are cowards. Pakistani leaders in the military sanction hatred towards outsiders and these shameless people should pack their bags and go home. They have not only let down the American people, their biggest benefactors, but also 180 million Pakistanis for deliberately misguiding/misleading them.

Pakistan has been made to become a drama not only by the military, but also by corrupt civilian leaders who simply don't pay their taxes. Six million children of Pakistan don't attend school. If the country is facing so much internal pressure right now due to gross negligence, we can only imagine what it would look like 3 decades from now. Six million kids are being forsaken every day by the military and the civilian leadership. It's a rudderless country, with 50 million illiterate people who would believe any bizarre story they are told by their corrupt leaders.
Take our troops and money and go home. They will end up killing each other just like in Iraq.

Of course we all knew that the instant BL was found in plain sight in Pak. However, this is a high value intelligence and releasing it to the public is an unusual move that must have a purpose.

Most likely, it's a scare tactic by the US to push Pak into submission. If true, it's a weak and hurried move. All we'll get is the usual mix of lip service, doubletalk, and bushwhacking.

A much more effective move, imo, would be a strong buildup of a strategic military alliance with India. The current administration seems aversive to strong action whether political or military (half-a** offensive, then half a** withdrawal, not a war on Lybia, etc.). It seems afraid of upsetting the 'delicate' balances around the world. Such a position may lead to the balance being upset by others, and to our detriment.

We are hated around the world, and neither contrition nor appeasement will change it. We were much more respected walking tall, something we are naturally good at and can still do.

Is anyone even slightly surprised by this? As Kipling pointed out quite awhile ago,

"And the end of the fight
Is a tombstone white with the name of the late deceased,
And the epitaph drear:
'A Fool lies here
Who tried to hustle the East.'"
I hope he never expresses remorse. Since he made it this far on his own terms he should run out the clock and play the system for all it's worth.

All the time and money spent on capturing this racketeer, someone like a character out of an old Hollywood gangster movie. He's an 81 year old antique. Can we now say the world is a better, safer place because the FBI finally got their man?

The legend of Whitey Bulger and his brother, Billy, is truly remarkable.  I am of Irish-American extraction and lived in Boston, and I can tell you that many Italian-American Boston area natives have most likely felt - known - that the Italian mob in Boston was less vicious than Whitey and his cronies were.  Whitey was downright scary - SUPER scary, ruthless, a true sociopath with a ruthless, iron fisted control over many on the streets of Southie (South Boston). I never met him and am glad - just reading about his behavior makes my hair stand up.  He terrorized people.  He was much feared and for good reason. He and his siblings grew up in a very tough housing project for the poor (mostly Irish Americans) in South Boston.  And then, in incredible contrast, you had his younger brother, a man who never has been arrested in his life, William "Billy" Bulger, a graduate of the famed Boston Latin School who knew Greek and Latin and quoted from the ancient classics and who was no less than President of the Massachusetts Senate for 25 years, later President of the University of Massachusetts and who purported to have no idea whatsoever what had happened to his mobster brother.  This is why the story of the Bulger brothers and their family is so riveting to Massachusetts residents, especially those of the older generation.

I thought they'd find Whitey in Pakistan....

also, poster Number 4 needs to get his facts right; Whitey's brother Billy was NEVER
mayor of Boston, though he was the Senate leader in the Mass. legislature for something like 17 years before he ran the University of Massachusetts system until Mitt ran him out because he knew that would reflect badly on him later during his presidential run in 2008.

A couple of corrections: Whitey's brother Billy was not mayor of Boston. He was the president of the state senate. He later retired from the senate and was selected as head of the U. Mass system, not U Mass specifically.

I was a federal criminal prosecutor in the LA US Attorney's Office in 1995 - 1996 (on detail from Main Justice, where I was a public corruption prosecutor).  The size of Los Angeles and the transient nature of its population and the resultant anonymity offered resulted in the Central District of California being a federal district in which individuals indicted in other districts were routinely apprehended - more often than in any other district to my knowledge.  In other words, what Bulger and his consort did - go to LA and hide amongst an imagined mass of humanity who principally move about in cars - is perhaps the most typical act of flight for a federal criminal fugitive.

For the record, Bulger's brother wasn't mayor of Boston. He was president of the state Senate, still by most accounts the most powerful politician in the state.

Also, the Winter Hill gang was based in Somerville, not South Boston. It was an established gang by the time Whitey took over after informing on the local leader of that gang. He moved in like a cuckoo bird. He may have been beloved in some quarters of Southie, but most people in Somerville hated him for having besmirched the Winter Hill Gang name. It was indeed a crime gang that got involved in violence, but he ratcheted it up way too much.
